name: Man's Chief End and Holy Scripture
description: The chief end of man—to glorify God and enjoy Him forever—and the authority, sufficiency, and perspicuity of Holy Scripture as the rule of faith and life.

name: God and the Holy Trinity
description: The being, attributes, and tri-personal nature of God: Father, Son, and Holy Spirit.

name: God's Eternal Decree
description: The eternal, wise, and holy counsel of God's will, including predestination and election.

name: Creation
description: God's work of creating the world and all things therein, especially man in His own image.

name: Providence
description: God's most holy, wise, and powerful preserving and governing all His creatures and all their actions.

name: The Fall, Sin, and Misery
description: The covenant of works, Adam's fall, original sin, and the resulting estate of sin and misery.

name: The Covenant of Grace
description: God's free offer of life and salvation through Jesus Christ in the covenant of grace.

name: Christ the Mediator
description: The person, natures, offices, and states of the Lord Jesus Christ as the only Mediator between God and man.

name: Effectual Calling
description: The work of God's Spirit in effectually calling sinners, the freedom of the will under grace, and union with Christ by faith.

name: Justification
description: God's free pardon of sin and acceptance of sinners as righteous through the imputed righteousness of Christ, received by faith alone.

name: Adoption
description: The privilege of being received into the number and enjoying the liberties and privileges of the sons of God.

name: Sanctification
description: The renewal of the whole person after the image of God, enabling believers to die more unto sin and live more unto righteousness.

name: Saving Faith, Repentance, and Good Works
description: The nature of saving faith as receiving and resting on Christ, evangelical repentance unto life, and the fruits of faith in good works.

name: Perseverance and Assurance
description: The perseverance of true believers in the state of grace and the grounds and means of assurance of salvation.

name: The Moral Law
description: The moral law as the rule of obedience for all men, its uses under the covenant of grace, and the rules for rightly understanding the Ten Commandments.

name: The Ten Commandments Expounded
description: The duties required and sins forbidden in each of the Ten Commandments, from the first through the tenth.

name: Christian Liberty
description: The freedom of believers under the gospel, delivered from the guilt of sin, the condemning wrath of God, and the yoke of the ceremonial law, with liberty of conscience in matters not commanded or forbidden in Scripture.

name: Religious Worship and the Sabbath
description: The acceptable way of worshipping God according to Scripture, the regulative principle, and the sanctification of the Lord's Day.

name: Oaths, the Civil Magistrate, and Marriage
description: The right use of lawful oaths and vows, the authority and duties of the civil magistrate in relation to the church, and the ordinance of marriage.

name: The Church and the Communion of Saints
description: The visible and invisible church, its Head the Lord Jesus Christ, and the fellowship of believers united to Him.

name: The Sacraments and Means of Grace
description: The outward and ordinary means by which Christ communicates the benefits of redemption: the Word, sacraments, and prayer; the nature, subjects, and administration of Baptism and the Lord's Supper.

name: Church Government and Discipline
description: The necessity and purposes of church censures and discipline, and the calling and authority of synods and councils.

name: Prayer and the Lord's Prayer
description: The duty of prayer, the rule and pattern given by Christ in the Lord's Prayer, and its several petitions.

name: Death, Resurrection, and Last Judgment
description: The state of men after death, the resurrection of the body, and the final judgment at the last day.
